issue.title: Updated the 2.8.0 release notes

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Should we be drawing attension to any other changes?

Signed-off-by: Simon Bennetts <psiinon@gmail.com>

body: Are there any plans to fix this? I'm still experiencing it in the latest version. Currently using a workaround by changing the shortcut to use the bat file, but this might not be sustainable for new users.

I am using openjdk 11.0.6 using an AdoptOpenJDK build and I get exactly the same error on windows 10 with ZAP 2.9.0 when directly running the exe.
I can just do `java --version` and get the following result:
```
java --version
openjdk 11.0.6 2020-01-14
OpenJDK Runtime Environment AdoptOpenJDK (build 11.0.6+10)
Eclipse OpenJ9 VM AdoptOpenJDK (build openj9-0.18.1, JRE 11 Windows 10 amd64-64-Bit Compressed References 20200122_442 (JIT enabled, AOT enabled)
OpenJ9   - 51a5857d2
OMR      - 7a1b0239a
JCL      - da35e0c380 based on jdk-11.0.6+10)
```

But this probably has to do something with the following issue from Launch4j: https://sourceforge.net/p/launch4j/bugs/205/

issue.title: ZAP 2.9.0 complains about missing Java

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
After installation on Windows 10 with Java 11 (OpenJDK 18.9) starting ZAP fails with message

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38438046/76328339-78b22980-62eb-11ea-8e0b-d034834cf85a.png)


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start ZAP by double clicking it's icon on the desktop

**Expected behavior**
ZAP starts using installed Java 11 runtime


**Software versions**
 - ZAP: 2.9.0
 - OS: Windows 10 64bit
 - Java: openjdk 11.0.2 2019-01-15

rename.to: ZAP exe fails with newer Java versions

body: @dnperfors (and others using AdoptOpenJDK) as workaround you need to select the feature `JavaSoft (Oracle) registry keys` when installing the JRE.

“ZAP exe fails with newer Java versions“

Is it a version thing or a vendor thing? Would “non-oracle” be more correct?

rename.from: ZAP exe fails with newer Java versions
rename.to: ZAP exe might fail to find Java

body: Right, that's not accurate, tweaked (feel free to change).

> Are there any plans to fix this? I'm still experiencing it in the latest version. Currently using a workaround by changing the shortcut to use the bat file, but this might not be sustainable for new users.

Thank you! I was about to give up until read more closely to see that:
**Using zap.bat instead of ZAP.exe is a workaround**

> > Are there any plans to fix this? I'm still experiencing it in the latest version. Currently using a workaround by changing the shortcut to use the bat file, but this might not be sustainable for new users.
> 
> Thank you! I was about to give up until read more closely to see that:
> **Using zap.bat instead of ZAP.exe is a workaround**

This workaround worked for me as well. Anyone know if there is a downside to this?
The only downside that I can think of is that you end-up with a cmd window open but that shouldn't be a big deal.

I have OpenJDK V. 15 installed and have the same problem, but zap.bat works for me too!

Thanks!

```
java -version
openjdk version "15.0.2" 2021-01-19
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 15.0.2+7-27)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 15.0.2+7-27, mixed mode, sharing)
```

issue.title: Error dialog "File not found 'Attack'" when ZAP started

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body: ### Describe the bug After starting ZAP an Error-Dialog with following message is shown "File not found 'Attack'": (Please see uploaded screenshot!) # Environment: ## Operating System: Windows 10 Pro Ver. 21H2 ## Java Runtime: openjdk version "1.8.0_302" OpenJDK Runtime Environment (Temurin)(build 1.8.0_302-b08) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (Temurin)(build 25.302-b08, mixed mode) ## Type of start/call: "zap.bat" in folder "C:\Program Files\OWASP\Zed Attack Proxy" ### Steps to reproduce the behavior 1. Goto folger: "C:\Program Files\OWASP\Zed Attack Proxy" 2. Type: "zap.bat" and press ### Expected behavior Just a normal start without any errors. ### Software versions ZAP: 2.11.1 Java Runtime: openjdk version "1.8.0_302" OpenJDK Runtime Environment (Temurin)(build 1.8.0_302-b08) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (Temurin)(build 25.302-b08, mixed mode) Windows: 10 Pro 21H2 ### Screenshots ### Errors from the zap.log file [zap.log](https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/files/9388726/zap.log) ### Additional context _No response_ ### Would you like to help fix this issue? - [X] Yes

body: Workaround using .bat works until there is an update. Would be helpful to know what exactly it is looking for.
It's probably an issue around registry or env vars. When installing OpenJDK you should select the two optional items (one is JavaSoft something, I don't recall the other).
That...and the key is to use OpenJDK rather than Oracle. Works better now.

> the key is to use OpenJDK rather than Oracle

Oh if you had Oracle Java installed then it was probably Java 8 and ZAP 2.12 requires min Java 11.
There's a new version (3.50) of Launch4j that might address this (https://launch4j.sourceforge.net/changelog.html) requires update in the Gradle plugin though (TheBoegl/gradle-launch4j#144).
